document_title: Placenta praevia: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
Based on the location of the placenta, the disease is divided into 5 types, including:
Low placed placenta: The placenta is attached to the body of the uterus and a small part in the lower uterine segment, not reaching the uterine opening.; Placenta accreta: The edge of the placenta adheres to the cervix, not covering the cervix; Lateral placenta: Most of the placenta is attached to the lower segment but has not reached the cervix.; Semi-central placenta previa: The placenta partially covers the cervix; Central placenta previa: The placenta completely covers the cervix, accounting for 20-30% of cases. (2)
subsection_title: rau tien dao.json. Common forms of placenta praevia

(2)
